message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,500. It's a great deal, and I'm sure you'll find it very valuable.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,500. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to make sure it's a good deal for me. What do you think?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I appreciate you being upfront about your price. However, $9,500 is significantly below what I need to accept. I'm willing to come down a bit, but I'm firm on $10,500.  That's still a good price for you, and it allows me to make a fair profit. What do you say?
I appreciate your willingness to come down, but $10,500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $10,250. Can you consider that?

Bob, I appreciate your continued interest and willingness to negotiate. While $10,250 is closer to what I need, it's still a bit below my bottom line.  I'm willing to meet you in the middle again and offer $10,750. This is my final offer. If you're not able to accept this, I'll need to explore other options.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle again, but $10,750 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,500, but that's as high as I can go. Can you consider that?

Bob, we're getting closer, and I appreciate your flexibility. I understand your budget constraints, but $10,500 is still a bit too low for me. I'm willing to come down one last time to $10,600. This is my final offer, and I believe it's a fair compromise that allows us both to walk away happy.  What do you think?
I understand that you're willing to come down one last time, but $10,600 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,400, but that's as high as I can go. Can you reconsider?
